10.1007/s10606-019-09357-w.title: Moral and Affective Differences in U.S. Immigration Policy Debate on Twitter
10.1007/s10606-019-09357-w.author: Grover, Ted and Bayraktaroglu, Elvan and Mark, Gloria and Rho, Eugenia Ha Rim
10.1007/s10606-019-09357-w.paperMotivationText: The authors investigate several hypotheses w.r.t. to framing in the US immigration policy debate. Two of the hypotheses are related to the prevalence of certain moral foundations in pro- vs. anti-immigration tweets.
10.1007/s10606-019-09357-w.paperContributionText: The authors collect English tweets related to US immigration policy. They then use the MFD to analyze the prevalence of moral foundations in these tweets.
10.1007/s10606-019-09357-w.paperResultsText: The two hypotheses are partially supported based on the analyses.
